urls.title: News | The Salisbury District Angling Club
urls.description: News items from the Salisbury & District Angling Club

tweets.text:
I've heard the @EnvAgency are surprised NGOs are refusing to work with them.

Why?

The River Avon catchment is comprised of 5 chalk streams protected as SSSI and SAC. In 2020 @wessexwater spent 26,916 hours dumping sewage into the river.

https://t.co/zslGdsV3lC

tweets.text:
My odour survey last night at 3.10am on the Galingale. What people are living with isn't fair or right, and clearly further capping off is required: the whole site if necessary @EnvAgencyMids #StopTheStink

https://t.co/g4i7E6iUZK

A reminder for #Anglersüö®

The close season for coarse fishing is in place until June 15th.

This means no coarse fishing on rivers and streams, we do this to give fish a chance to breedüêü

If you see someone breaking this please report it to 0800 807060 #Fishing https://t.co/IIvSugN8ZW

tweets.text: @AaronBell4NUL @EnvAgencyMids Smells bad in Newcastle Town Centre too this morning.
@AaronBell4NUL @EnvAgencyMids It needs to stop accepting rubbish now, not in 2026, it all needs capping off now and we need to get better at recycling.

@CertusCC @AquiferChalk @BuryLung @FreckenhamVH @theriverstrust @WildTroutTrust @N_Rivers_Trust @TheBrecksLP @EnvAgencyAnglia @OuseEcologyEA @NrtSam I would love to visit the River Kennet in Berkshire/Wiltshire. The River Kennett (2 tt) on the Suffolk/Cambridgeshire border is a rather different, more diminutive kettle of fish...and as far as i can see, currently troutless...

@AaronBell4NUL @EnvAgencyMids You need to get Boris up here and get the red industries owners in court and made to pay compensation to every resident affected we can smell it in bradwell most mornings around 5 especially if the wind is in this direction I've even smelt it along the A500 and by junction 16

@nelliephant @SianieRoo @RedIndustries2 @WalleysL @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids My theory is they are opening the wellheads on the gas extraction wells at night and releasing all the toxic gas and odours (despicable!). They should have a proper gas management system in place - to perhaps turn it into renewable energy.

tweets.text: @AaronBell4NUL @EnvAgencyMids If @EnvAgencyMids had not ignored residents complaints for so long it would not have got this bad.They are not fit for purpose and a independent enquiry needs to happen to find out why the issues at Walley‚Äôs Quarry was ignored for so many months/years @ClareDinnisEA #stopthestink

Unfortunately another incident of #flytipping that meant @EnvAgencyYNE & @Hullccnews had to team up to clear it away. As much as we love #PartnershipWorking we'd rather spend our time & resources in other ways. #StopFlytipping #LoveYourRivers #flooding https://t.co/LUh4m6QhhB
@AaronBell4NUL @EnvAgencyMids Can I say the if necessary isn't needed , the whole site needs closing as red can't be trusted .

@AaronBell4NUL @EnvAgencyMids How has it been allowed to spread this far over such a long time?? With this many complaints about it?? What is being hidden?? How much is at stake here?? And for who?? We are not stupid. Why is big business more important than kid‚Äôs health?? Our health seems unimportant?? Why??

Like clock work, every Friday night at 10pm the stench has seeped into my home, regardless of any other factors. That can‚Äôt be a coincidence. #stopthestink @RedIndustries2 #WalleysQuarry @WalleysL @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids

We‚Äôre getting it every night now in Westlands,it‚Äôs really ramped up,it does still seem slightly worse at weekends though& it makes no difference what the weather is like üòî @Cap_it_off #stopthestink @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK https://t.co/CTVigyWOw2

This is the most paltry reply I've seen yet from the @EnvAgency

I asked them if they feel historic landfills are under threat from flooding, if they're taken into account in defence planning and if any action has been taken in the past to defend sites from flooding. https://t.co/WQ0xjwb00z

@annjsmall @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @RedIndustries2 @ClareDinnisEA This morning I woke up and could actually smell fresh air ü§Ø then I realised someone else would be bearing the brunt of it. I am so sorry you have to endure this nearly all of the time. Who would believe it in 2021? Unbelievable!!

@numenini @AquiferChalk @BuryLung @FreckenhamVH @theriverstrust @WildTroutTrust @N_Rivers_Trust @TheBrecksLP @EnvAgencyAnglia @OuseEcologyEA @NrtSam It is a special river, Nicola. Am due to be at Eastridge for my first day of the new season next week and I know it will be in fine fettle, thanks the our fantastic river keeper Jack
@RedIndustries2 @EnvAgencyMids Why is it always worse at weekend? This cannot be a coincidence, it's every weekend!

Charities are stepping in to save children living in Newcastle under Lyme. Schools are sending letters about how toxic landfill gas is affecting children‚Äôs education. The situation is escalating. Yet @EnvAgencyMids is allowing waste back on site at Walley‚Äôs Quarry. #stopthestink https://t.co/SchV09qw1x

@ReebsBee @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @RedIndustries2 @ClareDinnisEA Weather makes no difference to us, it stinks every night, especially worse at weekends, occasional,y we don't smell it #stopthestink

It's absolutely disgusting tonight!!! The weather conditions cannot create the perfect storm EVERY weekend! @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @RedIndustries2 @ClareDinnisEA #stopthestink #capitoff

@AaronBell4NUL @EnvAgencyMids The whole site if need be is correct Aaron   This serious issue has been prolonged needlessly and now needs to be sorted and quickly. People have had enough of this dreadful stink and rightly deserve much better from the Agency !!

@SimonTagg @NewsNBC @EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL @RedIndustries2 There is no shame in admitting that you need help to manage this site. It is, however, shameful to prolong the suffering of thousands of people for profit or to save face.

@SianieRoo @hopeternalall @acrylicloveart @sweetutopia @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @PHE_WestMids @PHE_uk @stokecity What about asking @theAliceRoberts to help. She seems a decent human being who cares about people and the environment. She would be a big voice to call for your human right to clean air.

I see no reason why this isn‚Äôt already being done? Residents need this information to safeguard themselves given published instances above permitted levels

@davemh72 @EnvAgencyMids Need to step #stopthestink up now they cannot treat human beings like this @BorisJohnson @AaronBell4NUL find us a refuge until the poison has gone, our town is finished, my burgess ancestors will be turning in their graves. üò°

urls.title: B-lines | Shropshire Wildlife Trust
urls.description: The B-Lines are a series of ‚Äòinsect pathways‚Äô running through our countryside and towns, along which we are restoring and creating a series of wildflower-rich habitat stepping stones. They link existing wildlife areas together, creating a network, like a railway, that will weave across the British landscape.

tweets.text: Our enforcement officers, @AnglingTrust volunteers & @LancsPolice were cracking down on illegal fishing over the bank holiday weekend as part of Operation Clampdown 9. The patrol covered significant areas around #Preston where 3 offences were detected for unlicensed fishing. https://t.co/B3duYyTBJh
@DoddyDodds @EnvAgency Interesting comments as usual @DoddyDodds. What are your thoughts on alternative #groundwater abstraction licensing?

@GroundwaterMike @EnvAgency Are groundwater transfer schemes a good idea? English abstraction licensing rules means that the resource is locked out to other abstractors and it is not used very often. That doesn't play to GW's strength. Would you keep reservoirs full, just in case?

urls.title: Walleys Quarry Landfill Site - Latest Update - Environment Agency - Citizen Space
urls.description: Find and participate in consultations run by the Environment Agency

tweets.text:
Read our update to the situation at #WalleysQuarry üëâ https://t.co/o558iBcT3V

Our on-site inspection shows capping work required by the enforcement notice we issued is complete but we still need verification of the work by an independent construction quality assurance assessment https://t.co/12ep6fp39O

Out and about again this evening with Dorset Police and the Angling Trust Volunteer Bailiffs from Wimborne and District Angling Club in the Poole area patrolling SSSI still waters during the closed season. @EnvAgencySW @RuralCrimeTeam https://t.co/KZoDcKmil6

River Kennett upstream of Badlingham, lovely, clear, rushing #chalkstream, but assume cos now a winterbourne, only minnows & a few sticklebacks. Owner says 20-30 yrs ago it had trout. Rookery, Yellow Wagtail, pair Mute Swans, Mallards. #MySwim  #FridayFeeling #BirdsSeenin2021 1/3 https://t.co/h77kxVQpNg

On all fronts for the @RiverChess our biggest opponent is the @EnvAgency you would have thought we had shared ambitions. Apparently not, they have lost their way. They hide issues, misguide the public and Government and put the environment at risk, how has it come to this? https://t.co/EB81UUcQw9
